column1: 0515|5:15 a.m.|By the first week of May
column2: Ralph was waking up to birdsong at 5:15 a.m. He tried earplugs for a few nights
column3: although he doubted from the outset that they would work. It wasn’t the newly returned birds that were waking him up
column4: nor the occasional delivery-truck backfire out on Harris Avenue. He had always been the sort of guy who could sleep in the middle of a brass marching bad
column5: and he didn’t think that had changed. What had changed was inside his head.

column2: a tired & confused old man who's been jerked out of bed at 5:15.
